item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

item.name: Government ethics and transparency, public corruption

summary.text: Requires the Director of the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) to establish a publicly available website for tracking, in detail, all expenditures of funds over $500 which are appropriated or otherwise available to the federal government.

bill.title: To require the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to establish and maintain a website to track the expenditure of Government funds.

item.title: To require the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to establish and maintain a website to track the expenditure of Government funds.
To require the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to establish and maintain a website to track the expenditure of Government funds.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
